Package sru.edu.group1.workorders.services

Class UserServices

java.lang.Object
sru.edu.group1.workorders.services.UserServices
@Service public class UserServices extends Object
The most populated of all service files, primarily for sending emails and adding specific users with different roles
Author:
Trevor Bell trevorbell030@gmail.com, Ellie Wurst, John Friend, Hunter Minteer

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addAdminUser()
    Adds an admin user into the system, called a single time when you hit the login page, and will error if this function is ever ran again without checking for it's existance first
    void
    addBasicUser()
    adds a user with the normal user role, same rules as the manager and Admin additions apply
    void
    addManagerUser()
    adds a manager, much like the admin gets called a single time once you hit the login page, then cannot be ran again or it will crash for the unique key
    void
    addTechUser()
    Adds a tech user, cannot be ran again and ran a single time at login page if it doesn't already exist
    Users
    get(String resetPasswordToken)
     
    Users

    method to find a user by their password token

    listAll()
    will find all the users in the system and return them as a List of users
    void
    register(Users user, String siteURL)
    Adds a brand new user to the system once the hit submit on the registration page, defaults their role to user, and then sends an email asking to verify their account
    void
    reSendVerificationEmail(Users user, String siteURL)
    If a users' account is not enabled, they can request a new verification email to reverify their account
    void
    sendUpdateIncident(String email, String update)
    whenever an incident gets updated, the user who's email is associated with the incident will get an email
    void
    updatePassword(Users user, String newPassword)
    Once a user gets to the page to change their password, this gets called to properly update the password
    void
    updateResetPassword(String token, String email)
    finds user to update the reset pasword token, will return an error if the user is not found with that specific email
    void
    updateResetPasswordToken(String token, String email)
    method that updates the password rest token on a user whenever they request one to change their forgotten password
    boolean
    verify(String verificationCode)
    when a user hits the link in their verification email, their account will be verified as long as code of the email is the same as the one associated with the user

    • register

      public void register(Users user, String siteURL) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      Adds a brand new user to the system once the hit submit on the registration page, defaults their role to user, and then sends an email asking to verify their account
      Parameters:
      user - holds the user information to save
      siteURL - used for sending the email
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - catches character encoding issues
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - handles simple message errors

    • addAdminUser

      public void addAdminUser()
      Adds an admin user into the system, called a single time when you hit the login page, and will error if this function is ever ran again without checking for it's existance first

    • addManagerUser

      public void addManagerUser()
      adds a manager, much like the admin gets called a single time once you hit the login page, then cannot be ran again or it will crash for the unique key

    • addBasicUser

      public void addBasicUser()
      adds a user with the normal user role, same rules as the manager and Admin additions apply

    • addTechUser

      public void addTechUser()
      Adds a tech user, cannot be ran again and ran a single time at login page if it doesn't already exist

    • reSendVerificationEmail

      public void reSendVerificationEmail(Users user, String siteURL) throws UnsupportedEncodingException, jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      If a users' account is not enabled, they can request a new verification email to reverify their account
      Parameters:
      user - holds the info of the user requesting the
      siteURL - used for sending the email
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException - character encoding errors
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - simple messaging errors

      Throws:

    • updateResetPasswordToken

      public void updateResetPasswordToken(String token, String email)
      method that updates the password rest token on a user whenever they request one to change their forgotten password
      Parameters:
      token - sets a users's token to this value
      email - has the email of the user in question to change the token of

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword(Users user, String newPassword)
      Once a user gets to the page to change their password, this gets called to properly update the password
      Parameters:
      user - holds the information for the user in question
      newPassword - holds the new password information

    • updateResetPassword

      public void updateResetPassword(String token, String email) throws UserNotFoundService
      finds user to update the reset pasword token, will return an error if the user is not found with that specific email
      Parameters:
      token - holds the token to update the users' with
      email - the email the user put in to try and change the password of
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundService - a service that throws an error if the user is not found properly

      public Users get(String resetPasswordToken)

    • verify

      public boolean verify(String verificationCode)
      when a user hits the link in their verification email, their account will be verified as long as code of the email is the same as the one associated with the user
      Parameters:
      verificationCode - finds a user by the verification code passed in, if not, returns an error, otherwise will enable them
      Returns:
      true or false on if the verification code is correct or not
